text:
After 5 years of hosting a site using the +x version of your ssi. moved the site to a host that uses the shtml version. Updating the menu to sthml was no problem. The problem is too many clients were bypassing the menu and did not know that the url was changed. As a work-around, wrote 40 small html files that redirects html requests to shtml

Suggested fix:
  If client requests foo.html
  and server does not have foo.html and does have foo.shtml, then

  1. Process ssi as usual
  2  Change suffix of exported file from shtml to html

Thank you
You could configure SSI a different way, or use mod_rewrite to poke around to satisfy the request, but this isn't a bug in the server or any feasible enhancement.
